abstract: Henry M. Paulson Jr. intends to defend the “strong message” he sent to Bank of America’s chief, Kenneth D. Lewis, last year that abandoning the bank’s planned takeover of Merrill Lynch could cost Mr. Lewis and other executives their jobs.
snippet: Henry M. Paulson Jr. intends to defend the “strong message” he sent to Bank of America’s chief, Kenneth D. Lewis, last year that abandoning the bank’s planned takeover of Merrill Lynch could cost Mr. Lewis and other executives their jobs.
lead_paragraph: Henry M. Paulson Jr., the former Treasury secretary, intends to defend the “strong message” he sent to Bank of America’s chief executive, Kenneth D. Lewis, last year that abandoning the bank’s planned takeover of Merrill Lynch could cost Mr. Lewis and other executives their jobs.

headline.main: Paulson Sent ‘Strong Message’ to BofA Chief
